definitions.body: peradventure, perhaps; usually expressing a hope, as Ge 16:2, Nu 22:6, Nu 22:11, Nu 23:3; 1Sa 6:5, Je 20:10; but also a fear or doubt, as Ge 27:12; Job 1:5, sq. [[לאׁ]] Ge 24:5, Ge 24:39; in mockery Is 47:12; Je 51:8.

followed by another clause a)sunde/twv, it, it expresses vir-tually the protasis = if peradventure Ge 18:24, Ge 18:28 (cf. v:Ge 18:29–Ge 18:32) Ho 8:7 the blade shall yield no meal; [[אוּלַי יַעֲשֶׂה זׇרִים יִבְלָעֻהוּ]] if perchance it yield, strangers shall swallow it up.
in Nu 22:33 [[לוּלֵי]] (q.v) must be read; unless she had turned aside from me, surely, etc.
